#include<stdio.h>
#include<iostream>
#include<algorithm>
using namespace std;

int n;
int a[1000000],b[1000000];

void merge_sort(int[],int [],int,int);

int main()
{
    int t;
    scanf("%d",&t);
    while(t--)
    {
      scanf("%d",&n);
      for(int i=0;i<n;i++)
      {
        scanf("%d %d",&b[i],&a[i]);
      }
      merge_sort(a,b,0,n-1);
      int ans=1; int x=a[0];
      for(int i=1;i<n;i++)
      {
        if(x<=b[i]) { ans++; x=a[i]; }
      }
       printf("%d\n",ans); 
    }
 return 0;
}

void merge(int a[],int b[],int l,int m,int u)
{
int c[n],d[n],l1,u1,i;
l1=l; u1=m+1; i=l;

while(l1<=m && u1<=u)
{
if(a[l1]<a[u1])
{d[i]=b[l1]; c[i++]=a[l1++];}
else
{d[i]=b[u1]; c[i++]=a[u1++];}
}

while(u1<=u)
{d[i]=b[u1]; c[i++]=a[u1++];}
while(l1<=m)
{d[i]=b[l1]; c[i++]=a[l1++];}

for(i=l;i<=u;i++)
{b[i]=d[i]; a[i]=c[i];}
}

void merge_sort(int a[],int b[],int l,int u)
{
int m;
if(l<u)
{ m=(l+u)/2 ;
merge_sort(a,b,l,m);
merge_sort(a,b,m+1,u);
merge(a,b,l,m,u); }
}
